server.protocol

Interface Connect4Server

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetworkPlayer

    public interface Connect4Server

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • cmdWelcome

        void cmdWelcome(int assignedUserID,
                long allowedThinkTime,
                int capabilities)
        Response to a valid HELLO command from a client.
        Parameters:
        assignedUserID - this is the unique identifier the server assigned to the client who receives this WELCOME command.
        allowedThinkTime - the time the client has to send a valid response to the server in milliseconds. If the client does not respond in time the server will decide what to do next (this depends on the implementing server). Note that the allowed think time can be dependent on whether the client is playing with an AI or as a human, which was reported in the preceding HELLO command.
        capabilities - represents a vector with flags for the capabilities that are implemented in the server. See also the specification for cmdHello(...) in Connect4Client.java.

      • cmdGame

        void cmdGame(java.lang.String nameOtherPlayer,
             int otherPlayerID,
             int playFieldX,
             int playFieldY,
             int playFieldZ,
             int playerWhoHasNextTurnID,
             int sequenceLengthOfWin)
        Signal the client that a new game is started (i.e. an opponent has been found). All game settings including the id and username of the opponent are send along with this.
        Parameters:
        nameOtherPlayer - username chosen by the opponent
        otherPlayerID - id assigned to the opponent
        playFieldX - the x dimension of the playing field
        playFieldY - the y dimension of the playing field
        playFieldZ - the z dimension of the playing field, in other words the height
        playerWhoHasNextTurnID - the ID of the player who has the first turn and who should send his move to the server
        sequenceLengthOfWin - the number of chips that make up a winning sequence

      • cmdMoveSuccess

        void cmdMoveSuccess(int moveX,
                    int moveY,
                    int actorID,
                    int playerWhoHasNextTurnID)
        Tell the client that a valid move has been submitted to the server. This could either be the move the receiving client has made himself, but it could also be the move of the opponent.
        Parameters:
        moveX - the x coordinate where a chip should be placed on top
        moveY - the y coordinate where a chip should be placed on top
        actorID - the ID of the player who made the move
        playerWhoHasNextTurnID - the ID of the player who has the next turn

      • cmdGameEnd

        void cmdGameEnd(int winnerID)
        Tell the client the game has ended and reports the winner or a draw.
        Parameters:
        winnerID - the ID of the player who has won. -1 means it's a draw

      • cmdReportIllegal

        void cmdReportIllegal(java.lang.String theIllegalCommandWithParameters)
        Tell the client his last command was either not recognized by the server or was an invalid action.
        Parameters:
        theIllegalCommandWithParameters - The received illegal command along with its parameters

      • cmdPlayerLeft

        void cmdPlayerLeft(int leftPlayerID,
                   java.lang.String reason)
        Tell the client that a player has left.
        Parameters:
        leftPlayerID - the ID of the player who has left
        reason - a message generated by the server stating the reason why the player left (e.g. kicked)
